DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to compare functional status and quality of life of a group of patients with chronic venous insufficiency treated with manual lymphatic drainage with a group not treated with manual lymphatic drainage. Investigators hypothesized that manual lymphatic drainage can improve: - quality of life, - functional status, - calf muscle strength, - ankle range of motion, - edema, - severity of disease, - and symptoms.
DOC.brief_title: Manual Lymphatic Drainage in Chronic Venous Insufficiency: a Randomized Controlled Trial
DOC.criteria: Diagnose of chronic venous insufficiency class C35 for ClinicalEtiologicalAnatomicalPathological classification (CEAP). Severe cardiac insufficiency, Acute venous or arterial obstruction, Arterial insufficiency, renal insufficiency, Uncompensated thyroid dysfunction, Pregnancy, neoplastic pathology, Systemic or limb infection, Recent musculoskeletal injury in the lower limb, Peripheral neuropathy in the lower limb.
